alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 25 at 2:39PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Albany, northwestern Laramie and southwestern Platte Counties through 330 PM MDT... At 239 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Baldy Peak, or 18 miles northeast of Laramie, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Albany, northwestern Laramie and southwestern Platte Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills
